ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a láʼ fó tsɛ̀ɛ ntàb mbumté, ńtóŋo Mǒonsê, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie
en: Then the Lord summoned Moses   and spoke to him from the tent of meeting:  # 1:1 Ex 27:21

ngiemboon: à gʉa, ńtsẅii mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngie:
en: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them: When any of you brings an offering to the Lord from the livestock, you may bring your offering from the herd or the flock.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńge lɔgɔ nɔ̀ɔn gẅie mé ge tuɔ tà à pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, é nuŋe pwɔʼ mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbà à ge lɔgɔ nɔ̀ɔn té lɔ̌ʼ gẅie aa ndúm, é lɔg tó, é tyé ncwò ntàb mbumté, é ná, légwɔ́ gie anò yé ge poŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: “If his offering is a burnt offering   from the herd, he is to bring an unblemished male.  # 1:3 Ex 29:1 He will bring it to the entrance to the tent of meeting so that he  # 1:3 Or it may be accepted by the Lord.  # 1:3 Lv 19:5; Heb 9:14; 1Pt 1:19

ngiemboon: À ge zába pwó na twó nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, e Ssé zẅíŋ wɛ̌ pwɔʼ, ńdege mefʉa mé ńná né yé.
en: He is to lay his hand on   the head of the burnt offering so it can be accepted  # 1:4 Gn 33:10; Lv 7:18; 19:7; 22:23,25,27 on his behalf to make atonement for him.  # 1:4 Ex 30:15

ngiemboon: À ge zẅé nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, penkʉ́ Áloŋ pembàŋa pie ée panuŋepwɔʼ, é nyɛ metse nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ ńdɔg ńzaa jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ gie áa ncwò ntàb mbumté, ńza tà ńkéle ḿbumo.
en: He is to slaughter the bull before the Lord; Aaron’s sons the priests   are to present the blood  # 1:5 Heb 9:12 and splatter it  # 1:5 Ex 24:6; 29:16,20 on all sides of the altar that is at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

ngiemboon: À ge zíb ngùb nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, é záʼte mekèm mekèm.
en: Then he is to skin the burnt offering   and cut it into pieces.  # 1:6 Lit its pieces, also in v. 12

ngiemboon: Penkʉ́ Áloŋ pembàŋa pie ée panuŋepwɔʼ nyɛ mmɔ̌g ndùm jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, ńtáŋte mekèm nkẅíŋ ndumó.
en: The sons of Aaron the priest will prepare a fire on the altar and arrange wood on the fire.

ngiemboon: Penkʉ́ Áloŋ pembàŋa pie ée panuŋepwɔʼ, e záb mekèm ŋwɛ́ tà mbɔɔ twó lâ mefóon, á ndùm mmɔ̌g mekèm nkẅíŋ, á ndùm jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ.
en: Aaron’s sons the priests are to arrange the pieces, the head, and the fat   on top of the burning wood on the altar.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ gẅie à lɔgɔ́ nɔ̀ɔn ńtó, à sɔg shúm lepfòm pâ mekwò nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ á tsɛ̀ɛ ntse. Nùŋepwɔʼ pɔ́ɔnte ḿbú ńtuɔ nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, á ndùm jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ. E lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ shúm pwɔʼ sie mé ge tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà à pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm ntsèm, agyě kwɔ́ʼ ḿboŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: The offerer is to wash its entrails   and legs  # 1:9 Ex 12:9; 29:17; Lv 1:13; 4:11; 8:21; 9:14; Am 3:12 with water. Then the priest will burn all of it on the altar as a burnt offering, a food offering,  # 1:9 Dt 18:1 a pleasing aroma  # 1:9 Lv 2:2; 23:13 to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńge lɔgɔ mêmvfó, kà njʉ̀njÿò wɔ́ɔ, gie mé ge tuɔ tà e pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, é nuŋe pwɔʼ mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á gʉa na menɔ̀ɔn pé, éfaʼa ndúm gẅie aa té lɔ̌ʼ.
en: “But if his offering for a burnt offering is from the flock, from sheep or goats,   he is to present an unblemished male.

ngiemboon: À ge zẅé wɛ̌ nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á ngʉ̀ŋe jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, á na shÿó we twó. Penkʉ́ Áloŋ pembàŋa pie ée panuŋepwɔʼ, e lɔg metse nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, ńzaa jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ tà ńkéle ḿbumo.
en: He will slaughter it on the north side of the altar before the Lord. Aaron’s sons the priests will splatter its blood against the altar on all sides.

ngiemboon: É záʼ mbab mekèm mekèm, é kẅiʼi na twó pâ mefóon. Anùŋepwɔʼ pɔ́ɔnte ńzába ndùm mmɔ̌g mekèm nkẅíŋ, á jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ.
en: He will cut the animal into pieces with its head and its fat, and the priest will arrange them on top of the burning wood on the altar.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ gẅie à lɔgɔ́ nɔ̀ɔn ńtó, à sɔg shúm lepfòm pâ mekwò nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, á tsɛ̀ɛ ntse. Anùŋepwɔʼ pɔ́ɔnte ḿbú ńtuɔ nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ. E lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ shúm pwɔʼ sie mé ge tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà à pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, agyě kwɔ́ʼ ḿboŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: But he is to wash the entrails and legs with water. The priest will then present all of it and burn it on the altar; it is a burnt offering, a food offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

ngiemboon: «Á lɔɔn ne ńzɛ́te ngie nyìŋ lɔgɔ méshʉ́ŋ é nuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé ge tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà à pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, ńtóo mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á faʼa kàpʉ̀ŋ kà pɔ́ ngàbmánzsè wɔ́ɔ, ńdɔg ńtó.
en: “If his offering to the Lord is a burnt offering of birds,   he is to present his offering from the turtledoves  # 1:14 Gn 15:9; Lv 1:14; 5:7,11; 12:6,8; 14:22,30; 15:14,29; Nm 6:10; Ps 74:19; Sg 2:12; Jr 8:7 or young pigeons.  # 1:14 Or or pigeons,# 1:14 Gn 8:8–12; Lv 5:7,11

ngiemboon: Anùŋepwɔʼ kẅé méshʉ́ŋ ŋwɛ́ ńdɔg ńgʉa ńnáa jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ. É tóo wó, é soŋo twó méshʉ́ŋ ŋwɛ́, é tuɔ ndùm jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, é piŋ lɔg metse mé lɔg za mengʉ̀ŋe jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ.
en: Then the priest is to bring it to the altar, and will twist off its head and burn it on the altar; its blood should be drained at the side of the altar.

ngiemboon: À ge tsɔ́ʼɔ syè yé lâ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa tsoló, é zéʼe maʼa na shÿó sǎʼnèm we jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, á jʉʼ gie mé pfɛte pfó mefóon menɔ̀ɔn wó.
en: He will remove its digestive tract,   cutting off the tail feathers, and throw it on the east side of the altar at the place for ashes.  # 1:16 Lv 4:12; 6:10–11; 1Kg 13:3,5; Jr 31:40

ngiemboon: É shʉ́a méshʉ́ŋ nzsè pʉ́a á tsetsɛ̀ɛ mebabá, tá ké le fag nzsè pʉ́a wɔ́, é tuɔ ndùm mekèm nkẅíŋ, á jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ. E lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ shúm pwɔʼ sie mé ge tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà à pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, agyě kwɔ́ʼ ḿboŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.»
en: He will tear it open by its wings without dividing the bird.   Then the priest is to burn it on the altar on top of the burning wood. It is a burnt offering, a food offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
